business.headline: Own more than 1 property? Why you don't need to worry about additional taxThe reform announced in Budget 2025 regarding two self-occupied properties would encourage investment across the country's real-estate segment and would also enhance affordability for homebuyers.
Bears rampage Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty close lower on US tariff fearsThe BSE Sensex dropped 548.79 points to close at 77,311.80, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 178.35 points to end at 23,381.60.

Explained: Why you shouldn't stop investing despite opting for new tax regime Tax-savings incentives like the Public Provident Fund (PPF), National Savings Certificate (NSC) and Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) not only helped individuals lower their taxes but also induced disciplined savings habits, particularly among young people in developing financial prudence early in their careers.
Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta on SIPs: 'Don't fall for fear-mongering'Radhika Gupta reiterated that patience and a long-term approach are essential for SIP investors.

Markets bleed as investors lose Rs 6 lakh crore: Will the fall continue? The fall in the stock market led to a loss of Rs 6 lakh crore in investor wealth as market bulls took control of the Dalal Street.

When will your home, auto loan EMIs get cheaper after RBI rate cut?Experts say that borrowers with repo rate-linked loans will see an immediate or near-term reduction, while those with MCLR-linked loans may have to wait longer.

UPI fraud on the rise: 5 scams you must watch out forFraudsters often at times impersonate banks or organisations and trick victims to reveal sensitive information like UPI account, OTP and PIN details.

New income tax regime: Check revised tax rates, slabs, and will you benefit? Will the new tax regime put more money in your pocket, or should you stick with the old regime? Here is all you need to know.

Rupee hits all-time low of 87.94 against US dollarThe rupee slumped to a new all-time low of 87.95 per US dollar on Monday as fears over potential US trade tariffs rattled regional currencies. This surpasses last week's record of 87.5825. The currency was last trading at 87.9325, marking a 0.6% decline for the day.

Gautam Adani donates Rs 10,000 crore for social causes at younger son's weddingSources close to billionaire Gautam Adani said the Rs 10,000 crore donation will go into the creation of a network of affordable world-class hospitals and medical colleges and advanced global skill academics with assured employability.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayThe BSE Sensex lost over 600 points, while the NSE Nifty dropped close to 200 points in early trade. The Sensex fell to the day's low of 77,189.04 after closing at 77,860.19 in the previous session.

Sensex, Nifty tumble as rupee hits record low; metal, energy stocks dragThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.07 points to 77,466.12, while the NSE Niftt50 fell by 130.10 points to 23,429.85 as of 9:40 AM.

Rupee crashes 44 paise to all-time low of 87.94 against US dollarIn early trade, the rupee weakened to 87.95 per U.S. dollar, surpassing its previous record low of 87.5825 from last week. It was last trading at 87.9325, down 0.6% for the day.

Ajax Engineering IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPAjax Engineering IPO opens for subscription: The bidding process will close on February 12, 2025. Before the IPO opened for public subscription, Ajax Engineering raised Rs 379.32 crore from anchor investors.
Union Minister Piyush Goyal addresses trade strategy at business eventCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal discusses India's trade strategy, highlighting key areas like immigration and trade laws.
Finance minister discusses economic growth with RBI directorsUnion Finance Minister Sitharaman met with RBI to discuss measures boosting economic growth through fiscal policies and a policy rate cut.

Who is Asmita Patel, the 'she-wolf of stock market' under Sebi scanner?Sebi has directed Patel, her firm Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd (APGSOT), and several affiliated entities to return over Rs 53 crore collected as course fees.

Hope to introduce new income tax bill in Lok Sabha next week: Nirmala SitharamanAfter introduction in the Upper House, the bill, which was approved by the Union Cabinet chaired by PM Modi, will be sent to a parliamentary standing committee for scrutiny.

Meta plans to lay off 'lowest performance' staff next week, internal memo revealsNotices will go out to employees losing their jobs starting at 5 am local time on Monday in most countries, including in the US, according to one of the posts, authored by Meta's Head of People Janelle Gale.

Cabinet clears new income tax bill, likely to be tabled in Lok Sabha Monday: SourcesThe new legislation, which is often referred to as the Direct Tax Code, is aimed at overhauling the existing tax structure, making it more streamlined and transparent.

entertainment.headline: Comedian Kapil Sharma meets Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan YadavKapil Sharma met Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav in Bhopal and shared glimpses of their meeting on social media. He also expressed his gratitude.

BB 18's Chum Darang shares cryptic post after Elvish Yadav's racist remarksChum Darang shared a cryptic post on Instagram, advocating for respect and equality. This came after Elvish Yadav made racist remarks about her.

Decoding Grammy winner Kendrick Lamar's Superbowl half-time performanceKendrick Lamar became the first rapper to headline the Super Bowl solo, marking a major milestone in his career. The performance, featuring SZA and a memorable moment with Serena Williams, somewhat sparked debate on social media.

Jeetendra Kumar aka Jeetu Bhaiya on love, Panchayat, Gen-Z, Kota Factory and IITActor Jeetendra Kumar, popularly known by his screen name, Jeetu Bhaiya from Kota Factory, spoke in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, about the time when he, for the first time, tasted success. He also discussed his famous roles - Sachiv ji and Jeetu Bhaiya, and mentioned his idea of love and whether he agrees with the Gen-Z and 'situation-ships'.

Anaganaga: First look poster of Sumanth-starrer out, film to release on OTTSumanth, the eldest grandson of Akkineni Nageswara Rao, is set to star in Anaganaga. The first look poster was shared on the actor's birthday and it is set to release directly on OTT.

Newtopia review: Jisoo, Park Jeong-Min's zombie apocalypse romance is refreshingReleased-Fri Feb 07, 2025Newtopia review: Jisoo and Park Jeong-Min bring a fresh twist to the zombie apocalypse genre in Newtopia. Set in post-apocalyptic Seoul, the series focusses on love and humour amidst chaos.

The Mehta Boys: A beautifully crafted film about family, memories and unspoken bondsBoman Irani made his directorial debut with The Mehta Boys. The film, starring Irani himself and Avinash Tiwary, offers a deep understanding of relationships in modern India.

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs clips sparks debate, women say it mirrors real-life strugglesCertain clips from Sanya Malhotra's latest release, Mrs, have shocked the internet with several fans expressing their outrage in the comments section.

Podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia apologises for crass jokes: Hope you can forgive mePodcaster Ranveer Allahbadia apologised for making obscene jokes on Samay Raina's India's Got Latent. In a video statement, he expressed regret over his remarks and vowed to use his platform more responsibly in the future.

Sonu Nigam gets angry at fans in Kolkata: If you want to stand, contest in electionsSinger Sonu Nigam's performance in Kolkata faced unexpected audience disruptions. The singer was compelled to address crowd control issues to ensure smooth proceedings.

Kendrick Lamar performs with Drake's ex Serena Williams at Super Bowl, fans reactIn a surprise act, singer and rapper Drake's former girlfriend Serena Williams joined Kendrick Lamar during his Super Bowl LIX half-time performance, sending the internet into a frenzy. The tennis legend also shared a clip of her performance on social media.

Taylor Swift shocked after Eagles fans boo her at Super BowlTaylor Swift, the renowned pop star, faced an unexpected reaction from Eagles fans during her appearance at Super Bowl LIX. The unexpected boos left her and many others wondering about the cause.

Internet slams Ranveer Allahbadia over obscene jokes on Samay Raina's showYouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia finds himself in hot water after making inappropriate jokes and comments on Samay Raina's India's Got Latent. An FIR has been filed against Ranveer, Samay and those who were present as the judges for the episode.

Watch: Ed Sheeran, Shilpa Rao wow Bengaluru fans with Telugu hit ChuttamalleSinger Ed Sheeran surprised fans during his Bengaluru concert after he sang the Telugu hit track, Chuttamalle, with Shilpa Rao. He shared the video on social media and expressed his happiness at learning a new language.

Ed Sheeran clarifies he had permission 'to busk' in Bengaluru: It wasn't randomBritish singer Ed Sheeran has shared a short statement about his street performance in Bengaluru ahead of his concert tonight in the city. The artiste shared that he had permission to perform, contrary to the reports.

Punjabi actor-singer Harrdy Sandhu briefly detained over gig permit in ChandigarhSinger Harrdy Sandhu was detained in Chandigarh on Saturday for performing live without permission. He was later released after organisers provided documents. However, the incident left the Punjabi singer upset as he didn't perform after being released.

Ed Sheeran's street performance in Bengaluru halted by police. WatchBritish singer Ed Sheeran's Bengaluru performance on Church Street was halted by the police as it was being held without prior permission.

Shivangi Joshi Maha Kumbh diary: Holy dip, prayers and serene momentsShivangi Joshi visited Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj with her parents, took a holy dip at Triveni Sangam, and shared glimpses of her spiritual journey on social media.
Singer Lucky Ali 'dreams of getting married again'Singer Lucky Ali recently graced the Kathakar event where he spoke of his desire to get married again.

Papon's Kaun Mera song completes 12 years: Humbled by the love it still receivesPapon's soulful track Kaun Mera from Special 26 celebrates 12 years. The song's lasting popularity highlights its emotional depth and enduring appeal in Bollywood music.

general news.headline: PM Modi meets Emmanuel Macron in Paris, attends dinner ahead of AI summitIn a bid to strengthen AI governance, the Paris Summit aims to focus on a global governance model to make artificial intelligence more inclusive while ensuring safe and transparent AI for users across the world.

FIR against Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina, others over 'vulgar discussion'The Assam Police has filed a case against YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina over "vulgar" discussion on the latter's 'India's Got Latent' show.

Next Delhi Chief Minister won't stay in 'sheeshmahal': BJPThe bungalow, termed 'sheeshmahal' by the BJP, was a flashpoint in the party's campaign for the Delhi elections, with allegations of irregularities and corruption in the reconstruction of the bungalow and its lavish interior.

Trump says Palestinians won't have right to return to Gaza under US takeover planUS President Donald Trump first made his announcement to takeover Gaza during a joint press conference with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. During a recent interview, he said Palestinians won't have the right to return to Gaza.

CATS Warrior redefines unmanned combat aviation, know all about itThe CATS Warrior can perform multiple tasks, such as scouting, absorbing enemy fire, and attacking targets. In high-risk scenarios, it can be directed to sacrifice itself by crashing into critical targets, thereby preserving manned assets.

2 years after attack, Salman Rushdie to come face to face with accused in courtAuthor Salman Rushdie will come face to face with his attacker in a New York court nearly three years after he was left blind in one eye following a gruesome assault.
51 dead after bus falls from bridge in Guatemala According to a voluntary firefighters spokesperson, 51 victims of the Guatemala bus crash have been moved to a temporary morgue.

Delhi may get woman chief minister: Inside details of BJP's probables, planThe BJP, set to form a government in Delhi after 27 years, may choose a woman MLA as the Chief Minister, sources told India Today TV.

Ranveer Allahbadia controversy: When does a joke stop being funny?A viral clip from India's Got Latent has landed Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina, and others in legal trouble, sparking intense online debate - what is freedom of speech, and how far can you take a joke?

Why AAP's decimation in Delhi may be good news for Congress in GujaratGujarat's bipolar politics has seen a turn in the past five years, with the rise of AAP depleting the Congress vote-share and indirectly benefitting the ruling BJP

Case against AAP MLA after he 'interferes', allowing criminal to escape copsA case has been filed against AAP's Okhla MLA Amanatullah Khan for interrupting a police operation in Jamia, leading to the escape of a wanted criminal. The MLA argued with the police, asserting the individual was innocent.

School students parade luxury cars in Surat, probe launched after reel goes viralStudents filmed a video featuring around 30 luxury cars, prompting police action. Authorities are investigating and action will be taken against those who provided these cars to the students.

Serena Williams dances to Kendrick Lamar's tunes at Super Bowl, Djokovic reacts 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic praised the legendary Serena Williams for her dance moves during the Halftime show at the Super Bowl when rapper Kendrick Lamar performed the song 'Not Like Us'.

Did Prince Harry and Meghan Markle take a dig at Trump for his 'terrible' remark?After Donald Trump's controversial comments on their marriage, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle were seen cosying up at the opening ceremony of the 2025 Invictus Games in Vancouver. Is this a subtle reply by the Royal Couple to the US President?

PM looking forward to meeting 'friend' Trump on US visit: Chance to build on tiesPrime Minister Narendra Modi said his US trip from February 12-13 would be an opportunity to build upon the successes of bilateral cooperation in the past.

What makes some passports stronger for global travel? The strength of a passport is not just about its ability to offer visa-free travel, it reflects economic, political, and social factors that shape global mobility.

Even the obscene joke was copied: Internet digs out video to slam Ranveer AllahbadiaAn X user shared a video of another set of comedians cracking the exact same obscene joke that Ranveer Allahbadia made on Samay Raina's show.

Gambhir, you're not being fair to KL Rahul: Ex-captain upset over ODI experimentsIndia vs England: KL Rahul gave up his favourite batting spot to accommodate Axar Patel, who was promoted by the team management to bat at No. 5 in the first two ODIs. While Axar made good use of the opportunities, Rahul failed with the bat in Nagpur and Cuttack.

Shardul eyes Test return in England, open to playing County after IPL snubAll-rounder Shardul Thakur is eyeing India comeback in the tour of England, set to be held in the months of June and July. Shardul has been in sensational form in the Ranji Trophy with both bat and ball in the last 2 seasons.
Five don'ts if you're doing intermittent fastingSteady improvements in nutrition, portion size, hydration, sleep and stress management can bring lasting benefits from this trending wellness strategy

Singer B Praak cancels appearance on Ranveer Allahbadia's podcastB Praak has withdrawn from BeerBiceps' podcast after Ranveer Allahbadia's inappropriate remarks on Samay Raina's show India's Got Latent. He criticised the podcaster, calling this thinking "pathetic".

Elon Musk reacts to Senator's claim USAID funded transgender clinic in IndiaAmid US President Donald Trump's crackdown on USAID, Republican Senator John Kennedy claimed that the aid agency funded a transgender clinic in India, drawing a response from Elon Musk.

Jasprit Bumrah for Champions Trophy? Deadline day decision on cards, says reportJasprit Bumrah's availability for the Champions Trophy is under clouds. According to reports, the Indian team will take a call on Bumrah on February 11, the last day to make changes in squads for the ICC tournament.

Who is Nikhil Rajpal, a 30-year-old Indian-origin techie in Elon Musk-led DOGE?A team of young engineers, handpicked by Elon Musk, is working on DOGE. Aged between 19 and 24, the team has just welcomed Nikhil Rajpal, an Indian-origin techie.

Loveyapa actor Kunj Anand on film getting trolled: Easy to type few lettersLoveyapa actor Kunj Anand addresses online trolls, emphasising the effort involved in filmmaking and the importance of giving films a chance. He believes the film's unique concept will resonate with the youth.

Singer B Praak cancels appearance on Ranveer Allahbadia's podcastB Praak has withdrawn from BeerBiceps' podcast after Ranveer Allahbadia's inappropriate remarks on Samay Raina's show India's Got Latent. He criticised the podcaster, calling this thinking "pathetic".

Farah Khan's cook innocently roasts Aamir Khan's height as Junaid visits herJunaid Khan and Khushi Kapoor visited Farah Khan's home to promote their film Loveyapa. Junaid Khan's interaction with Khan's cook became the highlight of the vlog.

Saba Azad's fiery reply to troll who joked about her and Hrithik RoshanActor Saba Azad gave a befitting reply to the troll who said that she doesn't have to work as she's Hrithik Roshan's girlfriend. She emphasised the importance of maintaining her individuality and career alongside her relationship.

sports.headline: Champions Trophy: NCA team works hard with Jasprit Bumrah to get pacer fit The NCA team in Bengaluru is working hard with Jasprit Bumrah to get the fast bowler fit before the Champions Trophy. Bumrah hasn't played any form of cricket since the New Year's Test against Australia.

Mumbai Indians acquire 49 per cent stake in Oval Invincibles Mumbai Indians, through its subsidiary, RISE, claimed a 49 per cent stake in The Oval Invincibles, the most successful team in the history of the Hundred. The MI franchise recently tasted success after MI Cape Town won the SA20 2025.

Shardul has been in sensational form in the Ranji Trophy with both bat and ball in the last 2 seasons.

Ranji Trophy: Shardul knocks on selectors' doors, Suryakumar and Rahane shineRanji Trophy quarterfinal: Mumbai rode on Shardul Thakur's heroic six-wicket haul to secure a crucial first innings lead against Haryana in Kolkata. Captain Ajinkya Rahane and Suryakumar Yadav shone with the bat in the second innings to stretch the defending champions' lead.

Gambhir, you're not being fair to KL Rahul: Ex-captain upset over ODI experimentsIndia vs England: KL Rahul gave up his favourite batting spot to accommodate Axar Patel, who was promoted by the team management to bat at No. 5 in the first two ODIs. While Axar made good use of the opportunities, Rahul failed with the bat in Nagpur and Cuttack.

Find Hardik Pandya's game enjoyable, our playing styles are similar: Mithila Vinod India U19 Women's cricketer Mithila Vinod, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, said that she admires Hardik Pandya and finds her style of playing similar to that of the senior men's all-rounder. Mithila recently was a part of the Indian team that won the U19 Women's T20 World Cup in Malaysia.

Why is KL Rahul batting at No.6? Former selector questions Gambhir's strategyKL Rahul batting behind Axar Patel in the Indian line-up has baffled many. A former national selector has hit out against Gautam Gambhir's move which has affected KL Rahul's runs in the ODI format.

Williamson overshadows Breetzke, fires New Zealand to tri-series final Kane Williamson scored 133 runs off 113 balls as New Zealand beat Temba Bavuma's South Africa by six wickets at the Gaddafi Stadium to reach the final of the ODI tri-series on Pakistani soil.

Ravi Shastri backs dangerous Pakistan to reach Champions Trophy semi-finalFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri feels that Pakistan can be very dangerous side in home conditions. Shastri and Ricky Ponting have backed the side to reach the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025.

ODI tri-series: Kane Williamson equals AB de Villiers after hitting 47th centuryNew Zealand vs South Africa, ODI tri-series: Kane Williamson hit a 72-ball hundred, leading New Zealand's chase in the second match of a tri-series in Lahore on Monday, February 10.

Kohli urges fans to join organ donation initiative during Ahmedabad ODI  IND vs ENG: Virat Kohli urged fans to join the organ donation initiative when India and England face off in the third and final ODI of the three-match series on Wednesday, February 12.

If Rohit Sharma clicks, India will win Champions Trophy: Mohammed AzharuddinMohammed Azharuddin has claimed that if Rohit Sharma clicks, India will win the Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit came back into form with a blazing hundred against England in the second ODI in Cuttack.

South Africa's Matthew Breetzke sets new world record with 150 on ODI debutSouth Africa vs New Zealand in Pakistan: Opener Matthew Breetzke became the first man to hit 150 on his debut in a one-day international match. Breetzke broke West Indies great Desmond Haynes's record.

Real Madrid's injury woes deepen ahead of City clash: Lucas Vazquez outReal Madrid's defensive crisis deepens as Lucas Vázquez joins an already lengthy injury list ahead of their Champions League Round of 16 clash against Manchester City, leaving Carlo Ancelotti scrambling for solutions against Pep Guardiola's attacking force.

Rohit Sharma's 33rd century is loading as well: Suresh Raina after Cuttack blitzIND vs ENG: Suresh Raina feels that the 33rd ODI hundred is loading for Rohit Sharma as the Indian captain came back to form during the match in Cuttack on Sunday, February 9. Rohit was at his aggressive best during the second match of the series.

Explain floodlight failure during 2nd ODI: Odisha government to stadium officialsIND vs ENG: The Odisha government has demanded an explanation from Barabati Stadium officials regarding the floodlight failure that halted India's 2nd ODI against England for 30 minutes, raising concerns over infrastructure preparedness in high-profile matches.

Rohit Sharma's Cuttack blitz shows 'Bazball' approach correct: Jos ButtlerIND vs ENG: Jos Buttler has claimed that Rohit Sharma's Cuttack hundred shows that the Bazball approach is the right way to play cricket. Rohit played a stunning knock of 119 off just 90 balls to secure the win for India on Sunday, February 9.

Super Bowl 2025: Messi in attendance as Eagles seal big win over CheifsThe Philadelphia Eagles crushed the Kansas City Chiefs 40-22 in the Super Bowl, denying their three-peat bid as Lionel Messi and his Inter Miami teammates watched the spectacle unfold from the stands.

Confident Rohit Sharma speaks out against outside noise after Cuttack hundredIND vs ENG: Rohit Sharma lashed out against the outside noise after his thrilling hundred in Cuttack against England on Sunday, October 9. Rohit scored his hundred in just 76 balls as India won the match and clinched the series.

No Pant, Arshdeep yet: Bangar wants unchanged India XI for Ahmedabad ODIIND vs ENG 3rd ODI: Sanjay Bangar believes India should stick to their winning combination for the 3rd ODI against England, resisting the urge to experiment with Rishabh Pant and Arshdeep Singh despite having already secured the series win.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
